definition: surname Shua
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
a sideshow/vaudeville/juggling
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to get a monkey to perform tricks/to put on a monkey show/to make fun of sb/to tease
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
to play tricks on sb
to go into a huff
to play tricks/to dupe
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
to resort to tricks/to act in a slippery way/to try to evade (work, responsibility)
to play tricks on sb

sentences.english: Don't play a shabby trick on me.
sentences.chinese: 不要對我耍卑劣的手段。

sentences.english: I won't buy it, I know you are horsing me around.
sentences.chinese: 我不會上當的，我知道你又來耍我。

sentences.english: You can always go trick-or-treating during the afternoon or to the mall.
sentences.chinese: 你可以一直在下午或商業街上耍那唬人的把戲。

sentences.english: Plays the note to recover the hypertonia non-alkone sickness poison.
sentences.chinese: 耍注愈高滲性非酮症中毒。

sentences.english: He whips that "log" of a racquet around like a swizzle-stick.
sentences.chinese: 他甩動這笨得象木頭的拍子如同耍調酒的小棍。

sentences.english: You're a scheming little devil, aren't you?
sentences.chinese: 你是個耍陰謀詭計的小魔鬼，對不對？

sentences.english: This is always possible, even less playing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 一直可能就是這樣，連花樣也少耍。

sentences.english: Do not try any of those daredevil stunts .
sentences.chinese: 不要耍那些不怕死的絕招。

sentences.english: The acrobat is good at juggling with plates.
sentences.chinese: 那個雜技演員很擅長耍盤子。

sentences.english: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
sentences.chinese: 老友的好處之一就是你可與之耍瘋扮癡。

sentences.english: Lucy: How long did you stay there?
sentences.chinese: 你們在那又耍了好久喃？

sentences.english: I feel betrayed and creeped out.
Mccluskey: I think you got hosed . I just saw her an hour ago.
sentences.chinese: 貌似你被耍了，我一小時前還看到她了。

sentences.english: Refers to the uncertainty will move when the temper.
sentences.chinese: 指不定就會在搬家的時候耍性子。

trick/maneuver/razzle-dazzle/(martial arts) fancy move/flourish
to play/to have fun/to hang out
to go round and round/running around in circles/fig. frantically busy
acrobatics/jugglery/cheap trick/game
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
dirty trick
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to play with/to toy with/to dally with/to engage in/to resort to
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to tease
to play tricks
to play tricks on sb
to go into a huff
